page.title: 09GRAMMAR SCHOOL TRUST
page.content: Godshill Grammar School Trust. Believed to be the most ancient in origin in the Island,it was founded in the 16th century, the result of Lady Ann Worsley's will,directing that sums of money from rents on her lands be used for the erection and maintenance of a free grammar school in the Parish of Godshill.The funds, now invested by the Charity Commissioners on behalf of the Trustees, can be used to assist school leavers who live in the Ancient Parish of Godshill in furthering their education.The funds may also be used for "social and physical training of the children of the Parish".The Trust has 8 members_ Rectors of Godshill, Niton & Gatcombe, 1 representative of the Earl of Yarborough, 2 of the Parish Council, 1 of the County Education Dept., and 1 co_opted member.
